isis.stitle: 9 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RT-8609 SERIES - DISASSEMBLE - SHIFTER HOUSING

step1.para: Remove the two bolts and remove the tension spring cover from the top of the housing ( inset, Figure 82). Remove the three tension springs installed under the cover.
Tilt the housing and remove the three tension balls installed under the springs ( Figure 83).
Secure the assembly in a vise with the plunger side up ( Figure 84). Secure on the housing flange (front of the housing will be to the right).

note.para: Starting with the upper bar, move all bars to the right and out of the housing as detailed in the following instructions. Cut the lockwire and remove the lockscrews from each bar just prior to its removal.

step1.para: Move the LO-Reverse bar to the right and out of the housing, removing the shift yoke from the bar ( Figure 85).

figure.caption: Figure 85. Move LO-Reverse Bar to Right

note.para: During disassembly, lay all parts on a clean bench in the order of removal to facilitate reassembly. Bars not being removed must be kept in the neutral position or interlock parts will lock bars.

step1.para: Move the 1st-2nd yoke bar to the right and out of the housing, removing the shift yoke from the bar ( Figure 86). As the neutral notch in the bar clears the front web, remove the interlock pin from the bore in the neutral notch (inset).

figure.caption: Figure 86. Move 1st-2nd Yoke Bar to Right

step1.para: Remove the clip and actuating ring from the air valve shaft ( inset, Figure 87). Remove the air valve shaft from the rear web.

figure.caption: Figure 87. Remove Clip and Actuating Ring From Air Valve Shaft

step1.para: Move the 3rd-4th yoke bar to the right and out of the housing, removing the shift yoke from the bar ( Figure 88). As the yoke is removed, remove the two interlock balls from the front web (inset).

figure.caption: Figure 88. Move 3rd-4th Yoke Bar to Right

step1.para: If necessary, remove the plug, spring, and reverse-stop plunger from the LO-Reverse speed shift yoke bore ( Figure 89).

figure.caption: Figure 89. Remove Plug, Spring and Reverse-Stop Plunger
